div.head: ¶ Verses Written vpon the name of the Right woorshipfull Sir Robert Wingfeeld Knight.

lg.l: Regarding right, way wel in minde,
Of life and death the end of all.
Beware of freends that are vnkinde.
And seek to kill by curteous call.
Recoyle from him which layes a net:
Thy silly Soule in sinne to get.
VVith harty looue like wel that frend
Yn vvhome great vvisdome dooth remain
Neclecting vice, so in the end
Great gifts of God thou sure shalt gaine.
Flee swift vvith (Wing) and vvin the (Feeld)
Extolling Gods vvoord still on bye
Liue vvel, liue euer, to Vertue yeeld,
Dred God and Prince, moste carefully.
Keepe Conscience pure, and pa • y to God
Not liuing like an Epicure,
If that thou doost his heauy rod,
Great plagues and vvoes thou shalt endure
Heauens blesse the race being gody run
The guerdon is vvhen life is doon.
